private_information: Knows the first block of initial facts and the first planned action sequence.

Sees facts that include cats object_0, cats object_1, collect object_10 object_3, collect object_11 object_3, collect object_6 object_2, collect object_7 object_2, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_3, hand object_12, hand object_13, hand object_14, next object_0 object_6, next object_1 object_9, next object_12 object_11, next object_13 object_6, next object_14 object_8, next object_4 object_7, next object_5 object_10, sneeze object_4, sneeze object_5, spring object_6, spring object_9, stupendous object_2, stupendous object_3, texture object_10, texture object_11, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9
Has the first plan steps that transform those facts toward goal next object_12 object_10, next object_13 object_10 and next object_14 object_9
planner_A.goal: Analyze the first instance initial facts and plan, extract causal links, identify missing links and ambiguities, and produce a structured fragment describing predicates, objects, and step-level preconditions and effects.

private_information: Knows the second block of initial facts and the second planned action sequence.

Sees facts that include cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, hand object_12, hand object_13, hand object_14, next object_0 object_8, next object_11 object_10, next object_12 object_5, next object_13 object_7, next object_14 object_9, next object_3 object_6, next object_4 object_9, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9
Has the second plan that aims for goal next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_8, next object_13 object_5 and next object_14 object_7
planner_B.goal: Analyze the second instance initial facts and plan, extract causal links, identify missing links and ambiguities, and produce a structured fragment describing predicates, objects, and step-level preconditions and effects.

private_information: Role is to audit temporal and causal consistency across fragments produced by planners.
Responsible for removing bookkeeping shortcuts such as quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, ephemeral markers, and other non-physical bookkeeping artifacts that would obscure a sound causal plan.
Will normalize object naming conflicts and flag ambiguous referents for the orchestrator.
auditor.goal: Take planner fragments, verify temporal and causal consistency, remove bookkeeping shortcuts, consolidate and return a clean, minimal, causally sound representation suitable to be compiled into PDDL.

private_information: Receives cleaned fragments and raw planner fragments and integrates them into a single multi-agent PDDL model.
Targets the FastDownwards solver as the backend. The PDDL produced must be compatible with standard FastDownwards requirements and keep distinct action schemas per agent where applicable.
orchestrator.goal: Produce the final PDDL domain and problem pair that encodes the tasks and goals for the FastDownwards solver, integrating the audited fragments and keeping agent actions distinct.

public_information: There exist action schemata: paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted.
Action paltry requires preconditions: hand X, cats Y, texture Z, vase X Y, next Y Z. Effects: adds next X Z, removes vase X Y.
Action sip requires preconditions: hand X, cats Y, texture Z, next X Z, next Y Z. Effects: adds vase X Y, removes next X Z.
Action clip requires preconditions: hand X, sneeze Y, texture Z, next Y Z, next X Z. Effects: adds vase X Y, removes next X Z.
Action wretched requires preconditions: sneeze X, texture Y, texture Z, stupendous W, next X Y, collect Y W, collect Z W. Effects: adds next X Z, removes next X Y.
Action memory requires preconditions: cats X, spring Y, spring Z, next X Y. Effects: adds next X Z, removes next X Y.
Action tightfisted requires preconditions: hand X, sneeze Y, texture Z, next Y Z, vase X Y. Effects: adds next X Z, removes vase X Y.
Two separate problem instances were provided with full initial ground facts and explicit target next predicates as goals. Planners saw one instance each.
Planners are asked to produce structured analysis fragments. An auditor will remove bookkeeping shortcuts and normalize names. An orchestrator will compile the final PDDL targeting FastDownwards.

analyze.system_prompt: You are a domain analyst. Inspect the public information about action schemata and the first instance initial facts and its plan. Identify objects, predicates, action parameter bindings used in the plan steps, the preconditions and effects that each step relies on, and produce a compact structured fragment listing step indices, parameter assignments, required ground preconditions and resulting ground effects. Do not emit PDDL. Do not invent physical bookkeeping tokens. Mark any ambiguities or missing links clearly.
analyze.prompt: Agent planner_A analyzes instance one. Use environment->public_information and agents->planner_A->private_information to produce fragment_A. Output a structured fragment describing causal links, missing preconditions, and naming ambiguities.

analyze.system_prompt: You are a domain analyst. Inspect the public information about action schemata and the second instance initial facts and its plan. Identify objects, predicates, action parameter bindings used in the plan steps, the preconditions and effects that each step relies on, and produce a compact structured fragment listing step indices, parameter assignments, required ground preconditions and resulting ground effects. Do not emit PDDL. Do not invent physical bookkeeping tokens. Mark any ambiguities or missing links clearly.
analyze.prompt: Agent planner_B analyzes instance two. Use environment->public_information and agents->planner_B->private_information to produce fragment_B. Output a structured fragment describing causal links, missing preconditions, and naming ambiguities.

audit.system_prompt: You are a temporal and causal auditor. Receive planner fragments and validate step ordering, causal links, and consistency across naming. Remove bookkeeping shortcuts such as ephemeral quota tokens, post-hoc penalty markers, or any ephemeral bookkeeping artifacts that are not physically represented by domain predicates. Normalize naming collisions and produce a minimal causally sound merged representation suitable for compilation. Highlight any irreconcilable ambiguities for the orchestrator.
audit.prompt: Agent auditor receives {fragment_A} and {fragment_B}. Produce clean_fragments that are temporally consistent, free of bookkeeping artifacts, and normalized. Emphasize removed shortcuts and explain why they were removed.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL and compilation for the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the cleaned fragments and any remaining necessary raw fragment material. Produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem that faithfully capture the action schemata, objects, initial state, and goals for the tasks. Keep actions and their agent-specific variants distinct. The resulting PDDL must be FastDownwards compatible. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Agent orchestrator integrates {clean_fragments}, {fragment_A}, and {fragment_B} along with environment->public_information and agents->orchestrator->private_information. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem pair targeted at FastDownwards, preserving distinct action schemas per agent and reflecting the audited causal model. Include any necessary type and predicate declarations, list all objects, specify initial state and goal. Enclose domain in <domain></domain> and problem in <problem></problem>.
